title: Riot. can you please make reform cards show the full logs, as well as whether it was in /all
body:
context DOES matter in certain situations
a few examples.

* insulting an enemy champion. but in team chat.

* quoting someone using slurs 

* lying about another person's chat to the enemy team trying to get them reported for hate speech

* /all : Open mid "the entire team consents"

replies.body:
A) Still a pretty shitty thing to do, but I suppose it's not really banworthy.

B) Just don't do that? If you really need to say that someone else is using slurs, just say 'they're using slurs'. And honestly you don't even need to do that.

C) Even if they get reported for hate speech, the automated system would check to see if they actually said hate speech. If they didn't, it's not a problem.

D) If the entire team consented to opening mid, would you get reported for it?

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NbLAka6W,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-09-28T05:06:34.237+0000)
>
> A) Still a pretty shitty thing to do, but I suppose it's not really banworthy.
> 
> B) Just don't do that? If you really need to say that someone else is using slurs, just say 'they're using slurs'. And honestly you don't even need to do that.
> 
> C) Even if they get reported for hate speech, the automated system would check to see if they actually said hate speech. If they didn't, it's not a problem.
> 
> D) If the entire team consented to opening mid, would you get reported for it?


B, it makes it so you can appeal to have the ban reduced to a chat ban and/or removed more easily.

C. it can be used to escalate the punishment of the person lying. ESPECIALLY if someone on the enemy team took the bait and reported the intended victim

D. the enemy team may report you for saying it in chat,

B) Riot already has the context. The only reason to put in full logs is to make you look better if you post them in the forums.

C) Again, Riot already has this data. All you need to do is report them; begging for reports is generally considered pretty shitty already, even if it's accurate.

D) Doesn't mean you're gonna get punished for it.
Nope. Context explains the "why" of your chat. It does not relate to whether what you said should be punishable.

they won't do that...they hide under the guise of "you own your own actions" while hiding how bad you may have been abused, goaded, trolled etc.  Releasing full game transcripts is at natural odds with riot's "bend over and take it" policy.
